segments.text: I'm just watching this whole situation unfold, or rather, not unfold.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s frustrating to see so many things going wrong at once.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is completely engrossed in her dish-drying.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: She doesn't even notice the massive puddle her foot is in.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children are literally dicing with danger on that wobbly stool.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a surge of anger at the sheer obliviousness displayed.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Why isn't anyone paying attention to these obvious hazards?
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the cabinets and the floor.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Someone is definitely going to slip and get hurt.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It makes me want to shout a warning to everyone in the room.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The potential for injury and property damage is quite high here.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: This level of unawareness in a domestic setting is quite alarming.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I'm just waiting for the inevitable crash or splash to happen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like watching a slow-motion catastrophe.
segments.speaker: PAR
